DOC.brief_summary: Oxygen desaturation (SO2 < 88-90%) during walking is a common clinical feature of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) patients. By a predicted analysis our study is aimed to evaluate anthropometric and functional characteristics of COPD patients correlated with oxygen desaturation during Six-minute walking test (6MWT).
DOC.brief_title: Predicting Oxygen Desaturation in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Patients
DOC.criteria: COPD patients Ability to perform 6MWT Normal oxygen saturation at rest and at the begin of 6MWT NoCOPD patients Chronic Respiratory Failure patients in Longterm oxygen therapy (LTOT) Any comorbidities
